block.p: Alexandra Won Lee, the daughter of Suk Yung and Dr. Kie Bok Lee of Saratoga Springs, N.Y., was married yesterday to Dr. Richard Hoon Sohn, a son of Ryang Sue Sohn and Dr. Jeung Ho Sohn of Hollis, N.H. The Rev. Jennifer McKenna performed the ceremony at the Second Presbyterian Church in Baltimore.

The bride, 32, is a news correspondent in the Washington bureau of the Heart-Argyle Television broadcasting company. She is a graduate of Skidmore College, where her father, now retired, was a professor of economics. The bride received master's degrees in liberal arts from Harvard and in journalism from New York University. Her mother is a research analyst in the New York State Office of Parks, Recreation and Historic Preservation in Albany.

Alexandra Won Lee, the daughter of Suk Yung and Dr. Kie Bok Lee of Saratoga Springs, N.Y., was married yesterday to Dr. Richard Hoon Sohn, a son of Ryang Sue Sohn and Dr. Jeung Ho Sohn of Hollis, N.H. The Rev. Jennifer McKenna performed the ceremony at the Second Presbyterian Church in Baltimore.

The bride, 32, is a news correspondent in the Washington bureau of the Heart-Argyle Television broadcasting company. She is a graduate of Skidmore College, where her father, now retired, was a professor of economics. The bride received master's degrees in liberal arts from Harvard and in journalism from New York University. Her mother is a research analyst in the New York State Office of Parks, Recreation and Historic Preservation in Albany.

The bridegroom, also 32, is a cardiology fellow at Johns Hopkins Hospital in Baltimore. He graduated from Harvard and received his medical degree from Johns Hopkins. His father is a psychiatrist at the Community Council of Nashua, N.H., a group practice there.
